channel.title: 经济学人
channel.description: 这是一个追踪经济学人news的种子

item.title: 科学家可以通过培育胎儿器官的微小复制品来帮助他们。它们可用于改善子宫内的治疗👇。
item.description:
Scientists can help fetuses by growing tiny replicas of their organs. They could be used to improve treatments in the womb https://t.co/6hilaKPsXJ 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 9, 2024

item.title: 我们正在伦敦寻找一名实习生，为期六个月，负责金融和经济方面的工作。在 4 月 15 日之前申请 2024 年马乔里-迪恩实习机会
item.description:
We’re looking for an intern to spend six months with us in London covering finance and economics. Apply for the 2024 Marjorie Deane internship by April 15th https://t.co/gFt7pBYtAo

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 9, 2024

item.title: 削减国民保险费用高昂，而且正值英国公共财政面临压力之际。这种工资税的变化似乎是可以承受的，只是因为支出预测看起来更像是一种幻想👇。
item.description:
The cut to national insurance is expensive and comes at a time when Britain’s public finances are under pressure. The change to this payroll tax seems affordable only because of spending projections that look more like a fantasy https://t.co/gwclGqhFFn 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 9, 2024

item.title: 在阿司匹林 125 岁生日之际，其制造商却没有心情庆祝。拜耳能否从长期的痛苦中恢复过来？ 👇
item.description:
On Aspirin’s 125th birthday its maker is in no mood to celebrate.

Can Bayer recover from its chronic pain? https://t.co/UdRuq9IrpE 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 9, 2024

item.title: 比特币的价格正在飙升。但随着交易所交易基金的诞生，比特币的未来似乎只能作为一种投资资产。在最初的热潮过后，比特币的回报会是怎样的呢？
item.description:
Bitcoin’s price is surging. The cryptocurrency is up by 63% this year.

But with the creation of exchange-traded funds, its future looks to be as an investment asset and nothing more. After the initial surge of interest, what will its returns look like? https://t.co/VQm4VpHVwx

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 9, 2024

item.title: 想过当选英国议会议员吗？先看看这个： 马克-朗
item.description:
Ever thought about getting elected to Britain’s Parliament? Read this first: https://t.co/uo2A61vFl1

Image: Mark Long pic.twitter.com/TclCBGNlLS

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 9, 2024

item.title: 坦桑尼亚总统萨米亚-苏卢胡-哈桑（Samia Suluhu Hassan）无疑比她惨不忍睹的前任有了进步。然而，她就任总统三年来，言辞未能转化为行动，改革停滞不前，人们对约翰-马古富力（John Magufuli）时代的怀念与日俱增。
item.description:
Tanzania’s president, Samia Suluhu Hassan, is undoubtedly an improvement on her ghastly predecessor.

Yet three years into her presidency, as words fail to translate into action and reforms stall, nostalgia for the John Magufuli era is growing https://t.co/VLqjluD1gP 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 9, 2024

item.title: 失去改革坦桑尼亚的机会
item.description:
A lost opportunity to reform Tanzania https://t.co/5MA6v8IpVP

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 9, 2024

item.title: 第三党候选人可能给美国总统大选带来转机
item.description:
Third-party candidates could tip America’s presidential election https://t.co/ZH54ATnZYI

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 9, 2024

item.description:
More women are getting onto corporate boards https://t.co/5hyFcsHwXG

item.description:
How can firms pass on tacit knowledge? https://t.co/AgkoJrqLNu

item.title: 纽约是否正在重新考虑其庇护城市的地位？
item.description:
Is New York rethinking its sanctuary-city status? https://t.co/83EoxUztdJ

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 9, 2024

item.title: 中国议会一年一度的会议是橡皮图章式的。但它很重要。公民希望国家能够缓解他们的困境。今年很少有人会感到满意👇。
item.description:
The annual meeting of China’s parlia­ment is a rubber­-stamp aﬀair. But it is impor­tant. Citizens want reassurance that the state will ease their woes. Few will be satisfied this year https://t.co/H04d47UY2Y 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 9, 2024

item.title: 沃达丰试图通过瘦身恢复健康
item.description:
Vodafone tries to slim its way back to health https://t.co/XVhzhB9t8S

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 9, 2024

item.title: 芬太尼现在几乎可以肯定是 18 至 49 岁美国人的最大杀手。经济学家可能终于找到了危机的令人信服的解释👇。
item.description:
Fentanyl is now almost certainly the biggest killer of Americans between the ages of 18 and 49. Economists may have at last found a convincing explanation for the crisis https://t.co/xVmvxhehHh 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 9, 2024

item.title: 究竟为什么会有人成为英国国会议员？
item.description:
Why on earth would anyone become a British MP? https://t.co/ahGOo32GVh

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 9, 2024

item.title: 无论谁获得奥斯卡最佳影片，国际电影都将获胜
item.description:
Whoever gets the Best Picture Oscar, international films are winning https://t.co/in2YcT5na8

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 9, 2024

item.title: 中国议会被用来彰显习近平的权力
item.description:
China’s parliament is being used to highlight Xi Jinping’s power https://t.co/FaPSekzRyY

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 9, 2024

item.title: 中国的卫星正在迅速改进。解放军将从中受益
item.description:
China’s satellites are improving rapidly. The PLA will benefit https://t.co/Uk9tWZNbnZ

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 9, 2024

item.title: 中国的东北锈带已成为城市衰败的代名词。然而，正因为如此，它正被推向中国大众文化的前沿👇。
item.description:
China’s Dongbei rust belt has become a byword for urban decay. Yet precisely because of that, it is pushing to the forefront of Chinese popular culture https://t.co/n5KYLqJOge 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 9, 2024

item.title: 中国的统治者认为，他们对经济有着一致的愿景。但仔细一看，习近平的计划分崩离析👇。
item.description:
China’s rulers believe they have a coherent vision for the economy. But look closer and Xi Jinping’s plan falls apart https://t.co/6SIBWB4w3Z 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 9, 2024

item.title: 将印度教与印度划等号是纳伦德拉-莫迪意识形态的主要信条之一。批评者担心，莫迪的政党旨在将这个拥有 14 亿人口、其中 80% 是印度教徒的国家从一个世俗国家变成一个印度教国家👇。
item.description:
Equating Hinduism and India is one of the main tenets of Narendra Modi’s ideology.

Critics fear his party aims to to turn the country of 1.4bn people, 80% of whom are Hindus, from a secular state into a Hindu one https://t.co/3Pasvjt5hy 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 9, 2024

item.title: 中国正走在重建美国庞大而复杂的宇宙能力网络的道路上。其结果可能是一个相互确保太空脆弱性的时代👇。
item.description:
China is on a path to recreating America’s vast and sophisticated network of capabilities in the cosmos. The result might be an era of mu­tually assured vulnerability in space https://t.co/koKJSM8JxW 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 9, 2024

item.title: 美国的常春藤联盟大学是智力和经济实力的引擎。它们帮助美国成为吸引全球人才的磁铁，也是美国在科学创新方面领先的关键。但现在，它们的信誉正在受到侵蚀。
item.description:
America’s Ivy League universities are engines of intellectual and economic prowess. They have helped make the country a magnet for global talent and they are critical to its lead in scientific innovation. Now, though, their credibility is being eroded https://t.co/ei1zWeuAZt 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 9, 2024

item.title: 女性仍在努力突破玻璃天花板。我们的指数衡量了在劳动力参与、薪酬、带薪育儿假、政治代表性等领域的改善速度 #IWD2024
item.description:
Women are still struggling to break through the glass ceiling. Our index measures the pace of improvement in such areas as labour-force participation, salaries, paid parental leave, political representation and more https://t.co/mGdhlqL2nP #IWD2024

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 9, 2024

item.title: 长期以来，印度一直与饥饿为伴，如今却面临着肥胖和生活方式疾病流行的问题 👇
item.description:
Long associated with hunger, India is now confronting an epidemic of obesity and lifestyle diseases https://t.co/BbvJFIZoBz 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 9, 2024

item.title: 冷战期间，西方情报机构资助作家，有时是非常优秀的作家。以下是六本你不知道的宣传书籍 👇
item.description:
During the cold war Western intelligence agencies subsidised authors, sometimes very good ones. Here are six books you didn’t know were propaganda https://t.co/kl1QkttBNi 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 9, 2024

item.title: 近三分之二的佛罗里达人是从其他地方迁来的。他们搬来的原因有很多，但对本州（或本国）治理方式的失望也是其中一个原因。1843》杂志探讨了阳光之州可能支持特朗普的原因。
item.description:
Nearly two-thirds of Floridians moved from somewhere else. They come for many reasons, but disillusion with the way their home states (or home countries) are governed plays a role. 1843 magazine explores why the Sunshine State is likely to back Trump https://t.co/Pg7qIBi5ij

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 9, 2024

item.title: 在过去的 14 年里，比特币已经从一个小众的赛博朋克理念蜕变成一种接近主流的金融资产。比特币最近的价格走势可能会为加密货币的未来提供一些线索 👇
item.description:
Over the past 14 years bitcoin has morphed from a niche cyberpunk idea into something approaching a mainstream financial asset.

Its more recent price movements might provide some clues to the cryptocurrency’s future https://t.co/wGZhTNbiwI 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 9, 2024

item.title: 乔-拜登（Joe Biden）尚未推出针对南部边境的行政命令，原因有二👇。
item.description:
Joe Biden has yet to roll out an executive order for the southern border—for two reasons https://t.co/Hm5X9TPxM8 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 9, 2024
